sub_title: Team Lead People Operations at Booking.com
summary: Passionate HR professional with 10+ years experience in a fast-paced and dynamic international environment, having worked with labor laws of 20+ countries across Europe, Middle East and Africa, including the Netherlands, supporting employees & managers to create the best employee experience. Coming from a hospitality background, I strive to provide the best HR service possible to any stakeholder, and I believe in making processes simple and efficient to make everyone’s life easier. I love working with other driven professionals, communicating, coordinating, organizing, analysing, documenting and simply making changes happen effectively. My personal motto: 'What do you know if you learn every day?'

education.field_of_study: Higher level studies: English, Swedish & Geography, Standard level studies: Business, Biology & Math

profile_positions.description:
The senior role consists of both operational work as well as support activities for the HR specialist team and HR ops team lead. Tasks include e.g.:
- Guiding and coaching team members individually, both with ad-hoc queries regarding their accounts, and in a structured way for example in the form of analyzing work done and providing constructive feedback to aid each team member’s professional development and develop their knowledge
- Managing onboarding of new colleagues and providing training on several tools (Workday, Zendesk, SAP, etc)
- Assisting in arranging team activities, trainings and workshops around different areas identified that could be helpful for the team, e.g. around different complex processes, compliance, service or system refreshers
- Support the HR Ops team lead with various projects, tasks and do research and provide information where necessary
- Providing support for employees and managers of offices in South Africa, Kenya, Ghana, Saudi Arabia, Nigeria, & Dubai and managing the monthly movements for these (see summary of tasks of previous HR specialist role)
- Driving various process improvement projects (inter-departmental as well as within HR) for example related to compliance, efficiency and transparency

Key expertise gained in role
- Assisted in setting up new entities in Kenya, Mauritius, Jordan and Nigeria, incl. assistance with the
preparation of employee handbooks, analyzing local labor law, arranging health insurance via global & local brokers, managing communication with new hires, ensuring that all is well arranged from an HR & payroll admin side for the opening. This involved cooperation with many departments & vendors: IT, Legal, Finance, Compliance, Payroll, HR Advisory, Partner Services, payroll providers, health insurance companies and brokers 

- Managing transitions to new health insurance benefit providers including policy
negotiations, analysis, setting up processes for enrollment and administration for the local employees
profile_positions.title: Senior International HR Specailist

profile_positions.description:
Role included providing support for offices in different countries - South Africa, Kenya, Ghana, Saudi Arabia, Nigeria, Dubai, Mauritius, Turkey, Morocco, Egypt Romania,Greece, Cyprus, Georgia, Jordan, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Iceland, Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovakia, United Kingdom, Ireland.
- Assisting employees and managers with various HR related questions reg. policies, systems, benefits
- Managing administration for new hires, employment changes and leavers
- Assisting in setting up new offices in new countries, incl. assistance with the preparation of employee handbooks, assisting with arranging health insurance via global and local brokers, managing communication with new hires, ensuring that all is well arranged from an HR & payroll- admin side for the office opening
- Various process improvement projects (inter-departmental as well as within HR)
- Preparing monthly payroll reports
- Maintaining digital employee records
- Preparing reports for management and HR BP upon request
- Maintaining records of absence including sick leave, maternity and other types of leave
- Complying with internal policies
- Following local labor law affecting personnel administration, communication
- Acting as a point of contact for employment references requested by internal or external parties
- Maintaining & updating process checklists per country
- Supported the implementation of a new Jira ticketing system for handling incoming employee questions
- Supported the transition from SAP to a new personnel management system 'Workday', including testing the software before launching it to the business
- Managing set-up, maintenance and administration of health insurance policies for the local employees, following local labor law and benchmarks, working with brokers & insurance companies
- Launching a digital signing system (Docusign) in several countries to improve efficiency and making the employment administration paperless
profile_positions.title: International HR Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Assisting with HR paperwork & administration: Contracts, signing process, Excel lists, confirmation letters, other letters, hardcopy & digital staff dossiers, etc.
- Responsible for relocation of Expat new hires: managing the visa application process, making sure of sufficient housing including all necessary facilities, providing clear relocation information, making travel arrangements, welcoming the newcomers & doing the introduction on first work day
- Managing absence and keeping software records up to date, creating overviews.
- Assisting in organizing internal events - drinks, BBQ's, creative workshops
- Always ready for spontaneous tasks: questions from expat colleagues, occasional translations, making phone calls to help with arrangements & clarifications, looking up information by contacting the tax authorities or the immigration authorities
- Assisted with the 30% ruling process
- Maintaining lists with regards to staff administration: overview of contracts, contract renewals, expiring residence permits
- Office management tasks: assisting people on the phone, helping guests & visitors, receiving packages, making lunch occasionally, helping out with groceries and buying different supplies, assisting with board meetings occasionally
- Responsible for new employees' introduction process: explaining the basics, sometimes HR introduction done, making the newcomers feel welcome, take a picture, send around introduction e-mail to everyone
- Putting together company meeting presentations
- Learnt some payroll basics
- Learnt how to create a monthly headcount report for HR purposes
- Occasionally doing exit interviews with leaving colleagues
- Managing the company gym subscriptions and accompanying contracts
- Maintaining the intranet pages of HR & Office management, making sure all information is communicated in a transparent way: e.g. policies, procedures, handy tips, and much more.
- Probably more things to add that I will think of at another point in time...
profile_positions.title: HR & Office Assistant
